title: Device sign id to access password missing after 32 - 64 bit TB update - windows 11
content:
Have updated from 140.3.1 esr 32 bit to 143.0.1 release 64 bit TB and to windows 11 - uninstalled 32 bit and installed 64 bit and updated to windows 11 Following updates found that device sign in id (pin) was used to be in 32 bit missing from settings to access password but can show passwords. In reviewing the profile after update I note that Mozilla location service key, google location service key and safe browsing keys are missing (not sure what they were pre update). The key4.db file pre update was 1/3/22 but after update it is 10/10/25. The logins.json pre and post update is 7/9/25. I can see the default release profile and local only - use only the default release. My question is - has the 64 bit installation cleared all my keys/how can I check all my keys and how do I fix and ensure connections are secure?

Thankyou for any advice.
creator: hmrowe

Running on a mac. ventura. 13.2.1 thunderbird 140.3.1esr (aarch64) thank you for any help.


-andrew

title: Restoring problem on a new notebook giving the "You have launched an older version of TB" message
content: I have been using TB more than 12 years and were restoring via MozBackup before. Now I bought a new notebook and needed to transfer all the mails to my new notebook. My old laptop is still active and can still copy anything I would need. I copied the profiles and also the whole TB file under Roaming and tried to restore on the new computer. I couldn't do it in several different versions. Now it give the message "You have launched an older version of TB". I was using the version of 143.0.1 x32 bit on the previous laptop. But now I can not download the 32bit version of 143.0.1. I found 38.0.1 in my hard disk and loaded it and the restoring was succesfull. But this time I had no update option so I need to use the old version. I will be very glad if anyone would show me a way to solve the problem.

title: Import new calendar from NextCloud through CadDav
content:
I am using Thunderbird 143.0.1 (on Manjaro Linux) mail and calendar with NextCloud. I have several calendars and mail accounts, that works fine for about a year. Now I added a new calendar on NextCloud, it works with my calendar app on Android, but not with Thunderbird, whatever I try, it does not show the new calendar and it's content. In the Agenda tab under the calendar, all my current agenda's are shown. At the bottom right there is a sync button, that is supposed to reload the calendars and sync changes, but that does not work for this new calendar. All old tips for syncing are supposed to be integrated with Thunderbird.

Any idea?

Thanks in advance,

Kees

title: Changing Server Location for the "Sent" Box (Editing the Location)
content:
I have recently installed Thunderbird on a Raspberry-Pi - additional to several Windows PCs

I'm using the same Mail-Adresses via Thunderbird - and on my MobilePhone - on serveral devices.

This all works fine...

But Thunderbird on the Pi has created two "SENT" Folders - one is named "Sent Items" - the other just "sent".

Now - only the one folder named "Sent items" connects with the IMAP - the one named "Sent" only remains local - Mails sent from the PI DO NOT show up in the "Sent" folders on the other devices - all mails sent from other devices show up in the Folder "Sent Items". But the Mails sent from the Pi actually reach recipients and receive answers.

The Location for the folders is listed under properties as:

imap://[username]@imaps.[provider]/Sent (on the PI) - folder "Sent" imap://[username]@imaps.[provider]/Sent%20Items (on the PI) - folder "Sent Items" and imap://[username]@imaps.[provider]/Sent Items (under Windows)

To solve the Problem, I tried to EDIT the line Location under properties, but this can't be edited (doesn't allow entries - or delete with cursor - nor pastes from Copy / Paste.)

So how can I synchronize the SENT folder(s) from the Pi with the Server...?

Thank you for any suggestions
creator: GoodHabit

title: Draft email shows on all incoming messages. Draft & Inbox mirrored
content:
Using140.3.1 I have only one email address/account & it has worked happily with TB for several years, but recently all my incoming emails are marked as "this is a draft".

I cannot identify what has been changed, that could cause this, nor can I find a solution on line. Some similar problems have been indicated, but without resolution

I have noticed that when in "All folder" view there is no draft folder showing in the folder pane, but when in "Unified folder" view there is a drafts folder shown In this UF view, the received messages in the "inbox" are displayed and the same contents also appear in the drafts folder. ( But duplicated; Both folders show the same message count number although the actual number in the drafts is double that in the inbox).

Any suggestions would be welcomed, & thanks for reading.
creator: val.wilkinson3

title: Invio ricevuta di ritorno dopo l'arrivo di una nuova mail a volte non funziona dopo agg a ver. 140.3.1esr
content:
Dal 3 ottobre scorso data aggiornamento alla ver. 140.3.1esr, l'invio dal mio client della conferma di lettura di un messaggio ricevuto a volte non funzione e ritorna con la seguente dicitura (vedi allegato). Questo non per tutti i messaggi la maggior parte funziona solo quelli con la seguente parte:

Received: from 87.113.107.92.dynamic.cust.swisscom.net ([92.107.113.87]:64565 helo=[.................]) by sh00.ticino.com with esmtpsa (TLS1.3) tls TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 (Exim 4.98.2)

E' possibile capirne il motivo e ev. fare qualcoso in merito. Nell'attesa di una risposta da qualcuno che ha lo stesso problema, ringrazio e invio un saluto.
creator: olivio.beloedil
